answers.answer: Dear Friend,Many thanks for the post.We are aware of the main cause of this problem.We need to find out if something from the brain itself is causing this issue or not. Sometimes there are Sharpnells insude the brain which may be causing this symptoms.Hence the best way is to get a CT scan done, for the brain, which would help us to know the main cause (whether some physical problem inside the brain is causing all these things or not).Once the CT scan is done, then we can plan ahead.I have not suggested you for the MRI scan, as if there are some sharpnells present, then it may be magnetic in nature and can cause some serious damage to the life, while doing MRI scanning.Beside this, there doesn't appears a single other reason, which can be causing this issue.Please feel free to discuss further.Regards.

question: I am a 26 year old male smoker. 1 pack a day.  I have a traumatic brain injury from IEDS in Iraq.( Multiple explosions on different occasions)  For the last 8 months I have been having muscle tremors/jerks at random all over my body.  I cut out most caffiene from my diet and they have mostly went away.  They are only at rest not when I am doing something.  When I bend over at the waist I sometimes have a stop and go movement.  Does not happen every time.  My hands have a tremor all the time.  Not severe very little movement.  Has been that way for years.  My Father also has shaky hands and a sometimes uncontrollable tremor in his left hand.   After alot of repetitive movements(bicep curl or paddling a kayak) the muscle I am using will stay in the flexed postion.  Not painful just hard to straighten out. Just looking for ideas for what this could be.Personal Hx:  TBI,  muscular injury to thoraic spineFamily Hx:  Diabetes, Heart disease
title: muscle tremors all over body previous TBI
